Articles.Content: > > > 8 minutes ago, JadeOfMaar said: > > > [@Sigma88](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/113260-sigma88/) I'm loving the liberties you took with some planet packs. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)") Like Gameslinx getting a star. I must download some of these things and see up-close. In the meantime here's a DL link for my stuff. I've updated my thread with previews for theme #2. The configs I mentioned there are included but untested beyond dwarf and medium size. And their ghost settings will eventually change. > > > > > Any feedback is much welcome. > Gameslinx Planet Pack is still not **\*officially\*** supported, I'm still waiting for [@Gameslinx](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/144828-gameslinx/) to choose a star analogue and a name ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)") but the files are already there so if you install the mod it will get it's own star (A "B2 II" Blue Bright Giant, analogue of [Epsilon Canis Majoris](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Epsilon_Canis_Majoris) with a placeholder name)

[@Sigma88](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/113260-sigma88/) Not officially supported? Well in that case I'm pretty confident now that his innermost planet could possibly be inside the star. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif ":D") About GPP btw I see no code that handles Grannus. Is supporting code not needed or did you forget about Grannus? I'll see eventually in any case. ~~Not right now, but soon.~~

I was trying to figure out why KerbNet isn't working and I completely forgot about choosing a star, eek!

I'd kind of like a subtle blue-white star (I'm useless with star classes please forgive me) , which I believe is an A1 class? 

For the name, would it be possible to have "Azure" to go with the blue-ish colour?

I've probably missed something from the pm but I'll take a look and edit if I have.

Also, will GN check if my planet mod is installed and will place planets around the star, or do you have to download each update I push out? (Hopefully the former)

GN stars follow the vega color scheme\* (even if it's not realistic) so A would be "white" and B would be "blue white"

I think the star I have already chosen can be ok for you, let me take a couple of screenshots...

\* unless you use the setting for RealisticStars

Changelog:

    v0.4.1
    
    - Added compatibility with Gameslinx's Planet Overhaul
    - Fixed compatibility with TextureReplacer
    - Fixed realistic star flares
    - Changed some star descriptions

[@Sigma88](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/113260-sigma88/) I wondering how you  test your own mod. Do you actually load any planet packs or do you only test without any because after installing a few planets pack game start to hang at campaign game load. Perhaps its important that all planet packs are properly uploaded to 1.3, I don't know. It would be great if you could verify if all the planets packs are compatible with the latest release of Galactic neighbourhood. That would save me and others a lot of time.

**Edited <time datetime="2017-07-02T12:08:34Z" title="07/02/2017 12:08  PM" data-short="7 yr">July 2, 2017</time> by FreeThinker**

> 
> 
> Just now, FreeThinker said:
> 
> 
> [@Sigma88](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/113260-sigma88/) I wondering how you  test your own mod. Do you actually load any planet packs or do you only test without because after loading a few planets pack game start to hang at campaign game loading
> 

I usually don't test installing all planet packs, I test the single planet packs when I add them and the stars with "LoadAllStars"

once in a while I do a super install to make sure there are no major issues, and before releasing v0.4.0 I did just that and loaded all planet packs except

- <abbr title="Real Solar System (mod)">RSS</abbr> / RSSexpanded  

- SASS  

- Gameslinx  

- GPP

and with those packs (22) the game loaded and everything was where it was supposed to be

my potato laptop was running at fractions of fps (OS included) but that's not really something I can improve on ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif ":D")

keep in mind that <abbr title="Real Solar System (mod)">RSS</abbr> and GPP are still not compatible with 1.3.0 so that might cause some issues

SASS and Gameslinx should work fine with the latest versions of GN and the respective mods

The general rule is, if a mod doesn't load on it's own, you should not expect it to load on GN

I'm sorry if my question has already been answered, I looked in some pages of this forum and did not find it. Is this mod for the end user? If it is there is some tutorial on how to install the packages to use with it? Thanks!

> 
> 
> 12 minutes ago, Leandro Basi said:
> 
> 
> I'm sorry if my question has already been answered, I looked in some pages of this forum and did not find it. Is this mod for the end user? If it is there is some tutorial on how to install the packages to use with it? Thanks!
> 

this mod is installed like any other KSP mod generally is installed.

you download the .zip, inside you will find a folder called "GameData" then you extract the content of this folder into the GameData folder of your KSP install

you also need to install the dependancies (which are listed in the <abbr title="1. Original Post(er). The first post in a thread, or the person who posted it. 2. Overpowered. A part or mechanic that upsets game balance by being too powerful.">OP</abbr>)

if you want to add planet packs, just click on the name of the planet pack you want to install in the GN <abbr title="1. Original Post(er). The first post in a thread, or the person who posted it. 2. Overpowered. A part or mechanic that upsets game balance by being too powerful.">OP</abbr> and you will be redirected to the forum page of that mod.

install that mod following the instructions provided by the devs of that mod (usually a process similar to what I have described above, but it may vary)

keep in mind that if a mod is not updated to 1.3.0 it might not work (like <abbr title="Real Solar System (mod)">RSS</abbr>)

that's about it
Question, can anything be done about the loss of atmosphere?
Well done! Now we just need IA revived somehow put into this, and then we can have fun with Lich in this pack!

> 
> 
> 1 hour ago, FreeThinker said:
> 
> 
> Question, can anything be done about the loss of atmosphere?
> 

if you mean the graphical bug in the <abbr title="Kerbal Space Center">KSC</abbr> scene, that is a bug that comes with reparenting Kerbin and cannot be avoided with the current tools available

we tried to fix this into Kopernicus but have yet to find a viable solution.

it's just a graphical bug tho, it doesn't affect the game other than making the <abbr title="Kerbal Space Center">KSC</abbr> scene look crap

> 
> Ah. I guess wait until it's more stable (the last time I checked it was decently stable.)

on it's own it works because reasons, but when you try to edit stuff with <abbr title="Module Manager (mod)">MM</abbr> it breaks because all the cfgs have missing parenthesys or missing node types or similar crap that makes <abbr title="Module Manager (mod)">MM</abbr> crash when used to edit Kopernicus nodes

Just a small suggestion I thought of. I think it would be a good idea to change the name of the sun from "StockSun" to "Kerbol" in this mod, as having the sun be called "StockSun" kinda ruins immersion. It's only a quick config edit (I did it myself in 2 minutes) and would really be a nice quality of life improvement.

> 
>

> 
>

It's only a quick config edit (I did it myself in 2 minutes) and would really be a nice quality of life improvement.
> 

It was meant to be "Sun," I guess [@Sigma88](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/113260-sigma88/) never changed cbNameLater = Sun to Properties/displayName = The Sun.

EDIT: No, it does have displayName = The Sun. I don't know why you would see it in-game as StockSun.

[@Sigma88](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/113260-sigma88/) Notice that I have just released an updated a new version of [KSPIE](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/155255-13-kspi-extended-11414-05-7-2017-support-release-thread/&), which significantly improves the performance and capabilities of the Alcubiere warp drive in Galactic Neighborhood. Specifically it can now be operate in map view under time acceleration and can travel at high speed in both solar systems as interstellar space and has the capability to use celestial bodies to break inertial momentum allowing vessels to travel interstellar distances without having to adjust huge differences in speed.
